pros: Kind People, Amazing students, lots of learning.
cons: Small office environment and work on weekends occasionally.

review_title: I looked forward to work every day.
pros: My time at EUSA provided me with my first real example of how to collaborate effectively with co-workers. The atmosphere was friendly and I had lovely, smart colleagues. Staff really cared about the work and the students. Family benefits were generous. Everyone is treated as an individual with unique talents and there are opportunities to grow within the company. My work was recognized and I felt valued.
cons: Workload can be a bit busy and stressful at certain periods of the year.

review_title: Loved my colleagues, different kind of work
pros: Very interesting colleagues - into education, travel, having fun. Flexible work arrangements. Opportunity to travel to US. Chance to make a lot of contacts and connections with different kinds of companies.
cons: Can get pretty stressy at the busiest times. UK immigration compliance is very strict and requires a lot of paperwork. US universities are becoming more corporate, some students expect a "customer is king" approach.

job_title: Human Resources Administrator in Hemel Hempstead, England
pros:
Good Company to work for very flexible and supportive
Good Culture and great ethics
Friendly Team good dynamics wld work for them again of a full time job was available
